Content.Abstract: Whether you're willing to give five minutes or an entire semester of service, there are many ways to get involved with the Student Representative Council.
Content.BodyCopy:
Get Involved with SRC

The Student Representative Council (SRC) is a part of the Student Support organization. There are many ways you can get involved with SRC. Whether you have 5-10 minutes each week or are looking for serious responsibility and leadership opportunities, the SRC has a place for you. Service in the SRC allows you to participate in important issues affecting students.

Student Voice Member

Time Commitment: 5-10 minutes / week

As a Student Voice Member you can share your opinions about a wide array of issues at BYU-Idaho. Each week or as needed you will receive a brief survey on topics that are being considered by the university administration. Campus leaders are interested in hearing your input to make decisions that are in the best interest of the students. Your participation will help the SRC more effectively represent the voice of students to the administrators at BYU-Idaho.

Student Voice Volunteer

Time Commitment: 2 hours / week

In addition to taking the Student Voice Surveys, Student Voice Volunteers attend a weekly student voice meeting to help create, review and sort survey results, participate in and organize focus groups and to discuss concerns or issues with students. Student Voice Volunteers help to sort and summarize all feedback responses as well as analyze and propose solutions that are reported back to the administration and to the students. Student Voice Volunteers report directly to the Student Voice Program Managers.

Council Member Postions

Council members are chosen through an application and interview process. They commit to serve for an entire semester and to fulfill assigned office hours according to their position description.

Student Voice Program Managers

Time Commitment: 6-8 hours / week

Student Voice Coordinator

Time Commitment: 8-10 hours / week

The Student Voice Coordinator, under the direction of the SRC Director, works together with the Student Voice Program Managers and the Student Support Involvement Council to select and train the Student Voice Volunteers. They will conduct the Student Voice sessions and schedule time for the Student Representatives to present or discuss issues and solutions in the meetings. The Student Voice Coordinator gathers all Student Voice surveys and prepares them for distribution. The Student Voice Coordinator reports directly to the SRC Director.

Student Representatives

Time Commitment: 6-8 hours / week

6 - 8 Students Representatives on the SRC will represent the students of BYU-Idaho as they serve as a member of various university administrative councils. Each Student Representative will be assigned to regularly and actively participate in one or two of the university's administrative councils. Their participation in that council should guide and enhance their work in identifying, understanding, and acting on student issues. All of the work of Student Representatives are focused on producing solutions for global student issues. The Student Representatives report directly to the Student Representative Coordinators.

Student Representative Coordinators

Time Commitment: 8-10 hours / week
